Welcome to the Carbon Tracking App
Distances must be greater than zero

array.name: TIPS
array.item: When possible, walk or ride your bike in order to avoid carbon emissions completely.
Try to avoid speeding and unnecessary acceleration as it may increase your mileage by up to 33%. It also wastes gas and money.
Inflating your tires regularly could help you improve your gas mileage by up to 3%.
Being stuck in traffic wastes gas and unnecessarily creates CO2. Try using traffic websites and apps and go a different way or wait.
Try combining errands so that you have to make fewer trips.
Try removing excess weight from your car to help with fuel efficiency.
If you are planning on switching or buying a new car, consider one with a higher mileage or an electric vehicle.
Carpool when possible to further reduce your carbon footprint.
Consider using ePlusGreen’s PC energy-saving technology as the system monitor minimizes computer and printer energy usage.
Insulate and seal your home. Reduce drafts and air leaks with caulk, insulation, and weather stripping.

Make energy efficiency a primary consideration when choosing a new furnace, air conditioning unit, dishwasher, or refrigerator. Products bearing the ENERGY STAR label are recognized for having superior efficiency.
Turn off lights you’re not using and when you leave the room. Replace incandescent light bulbs with compact florescent or LED ones.
Try to avoid setting your thermostat too high or low. Consider installing a programmable model to turn off the heat/air conditioning when you’re not home.
Consider adding solar panels to the roof of your home if you can afford the cost.
Shorter showers might help cut down emissions from hot water heater.

resources.string: generated per person daily from your electricity and gas usage.
Some of the trips you had were of small distances.
Your journey seems to cover a large distance, please follow these tips to ensure minimum carbon emission.
Your car\'s fuel efficiency is lower than the average.
Click to edit, Long Click to delete. Click the button to go to Footprint Table
